author: @LeTelegramme
title: L'Orchestre national de Bretagne vient jouer du clavecin au Palais des congrès de Loudéac le 1er février
text:
L’Orchestre national de Bretagne sera de passage à Loudéac le samedi 1er février 2025, au Palais des congrès et de la culture. Dans ce spectacle « Les Héritiers de Bach », le directeur, Jory Vinikour, met le clavecin à l’honneur.
Dirigé par le claveciniste Jory Vinikour, l’Orchestre national de Bretagne rendra visite au Palais des congrès de Loudéac, le samedi 1er février 2025. Entouré de 23 musiciens de l’orchestre, dont les deux solistes Fabien Boudot et Éric Bescond, le spectacle « Les Héritiers de Bach » est autant une plongée dans l’univers de Jean-Sébastien Bach qu’une traversée dans le temps et les époques, mêlant baroque et musique contemporaine.
Au programme, Jean-Sébastien Bach, « Concerto pour violon n° 2 en Mi-Majeur, BWV 1042 » ; Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach, « Concerto pour clavecin en Ré mineur, H.427 » ; Michael Nyman, « Concerto pour clavecin amplifié » et Jean-Sébastien Bach, « Concerto pour flûte, violon et clavecin, BWV 1044 ».
« Les Héritiers de Bach », samedi 1er février 2025 à 20 h 30, au Palais des congrès et de la culture de Loudéac. Durée : 2 h 15, entracte inclus. Tarifs de 20 à 27 €. Billetterie ouverte sur le site internet.

author: MENAFN
title: Jordan, Iraq Warn Of Israeli Occupation's Illegal Actions In West Bank
text:
( MENAFN - Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)) AMMAN, Aug 22 (KUNA) -- Jordanian Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi and his Iraqi counterpart Fuad Hussien warned on Thursday of the grave consequences of the continued illegal measures of the Israeli Occupation in the occupied West Bank, including East Jerusalem.
The warning included the construction and expansion of settlements, the seizure of Palestinian lands, the attacks on Islamic and Christian holy sites in occupied Jerusalem, and settler terrorism.
The Jordanian Foreign Ministry added in a statement that this came about during a call between Safadi and his Iraqi counterpart Hussein, while discussing efforts to stop the aggression on Gaza, and reduce escalation in the region.
The two ministers assured that stopping the Israeli occupation's aggression on Gaza and all its violations under international law constitute the basis of stopping the escalation that threatens the region and its prosperity.
They stressed the need of the international community and its institutions to take up their responsibility and take practical measures to oblige the Israeli occupation to end its aggression on Gaza and respect international and humanitarian laws. (end) amn

author: El Correo Gallego
title: El tiempo en Monterroso: previsión meteorológica para hoy, viernes 29 de diciembre
text:
Hoy en Monterroso, se espera un día con cielos cubiertos y lluvias escasas durante la mayor parte del día. La temperatura se mantendrá bastante constante, con valores alrededor de los 8-10 grados . Sin embargo, la sensación térmica será ligeramente más baja, debido a la humedad presente en el ambiente.
Durante la mañana, el cielo estará cubierto y se registrarán lluvias escasas. La probabilidad de precipitación será del 100% en este periodo, por lo que es recomendable llevar un paraguas o impermeable al salir de casa. La temperatura estará alrededor de los 8-10 grados , con una sensación térmica ligeramente más baja.
A medida que avance el día, la lluvia disminuirá en intensidad, pero el cielo seguirá cubierto. La probabilidad de precipitación será del 90% durante la tarde, por lo que aún es posible que se registren algunas lluvias escasas. La temperatura se mantendrá en torno a los 8-9 grados , con una sensación térmica similar.
Durante la noche, el cielo continuará cubierto, pero la probabilidad de precipitación disminuirá al 75%. La temperatura descenderá ligeramente, alcanzando los 8 grados , con una sensación térmica similar. Es posible que se registren algunas brumas durante esta hora, por lo que es recomendable tener precaución al conducir.
En cuanto al viento, predominará la dirección del sur durante la mayor parte del día, con velocidades entre 8 y 11 km/h. Sin embargo, durante la mañana se esperan ráfagas de viento de hasta 20 km/h. Durante la tarde y la noche, el viento será más suave, con velocidades entre 4 y 9 km/h, proveniente de diferentes direcciones.
En resumen, hoy en Monterroso se espera un día con cielos cubiertos y lluvias escasas. La temperatura se mantendrá alrededor de los 8-10 grados , con una sensación térmica ligeramente más baja. Es recomendable llevar un paraguas o impermeable, ya que la probabilidad de precipitación será alta durante la mañana y la tarde. Además, es importante tener precaución al conducir debido a la posible presencia de brumas durante la noche.
Información elaborada utilizando, entre otras, la obtenida de la
Agencia Estatal de Meteorología. © AEMET. Fecha de actualización de los datos: 2023-12-28T22:44:07

author: Yahoo Sports
title: Lions re-sign Al-Quadin Muhammad to a one-year deal
text:
The Lions agreed to a one-year deal with defensive end Al-Quadin Muhammad, according to multiple reports.
Muhammad, who turns 30 later this month, played nine games with two starts last season for the Lions. He saw action on 255 defensive snaps.
Muhammad totaled three sacks, 11 tackles and five quarterback hits.
He did not make the Cowboys’ roster out of training camp last season and re-signed to the Lions’ practice squad in early October after Marcus Davenport’s season-ending torn triceps. He served a six-game suspension to start the season for violating the league’s policy on performance enhancing substances.

author: Rylan Howe rhowe@nwestiowa.com
title: A season of celebration
text:
Solsma’s Punkin Patch marks 25 years of operation
Some folks may like to keep up Christmas decorations for as long as possible. For Amy Solsma, it’s fall decor all year round.
That may have something to do with owning and operating Solsma’s Punkin Patch near Sanborn for the past 25 years.
And that’s something they’ll be celebrating all season long.
“I decided that instead of just celebrating one day, why not do a month? You never know what the weather’s going to do,” Solsma said. “So we’re having a few events starting Sept. 21 with free face painting and some wine tasting with Hidden Vineyard. In addition to our regular activities we’ll start having food trucks that weekend as well. On Sept. 28 we’ll have car cruise-in, then Oct. 5 we’ll have the Great Punkin Smash. People that visit that day can sign up and if they’re chosen they get to smash a pumpkin with a prize inside. And then Oct. 12 we’ll have a pumpkin decorating contest that will be a lot of fun.”
Fun is something families have been able to have at Solsma’s for many years, and it’s something Amy looks forward to each autumn.
“It’s hard to comprehend that I’ve been doing this that long, but it’s true and we’ve got the pictures to prove it!” Solsma said. “I’m certainly proud of what we’ve done over the years and we’ve tried to add something fun every year, sometimes it’s big things and sometimes it’s little things but we keep it fresh and it’s always free to come out to the yard, which has always been important to me — making it affordable and family friendly.”
Something new this year is a break from their usual corn maze.
Solsma said they don’t typically do designs but in celebration of their 25th year decided to give it a shot.
“So I wrote out Solsma’s with a big pumpkin and XXV for 25 — it’s free hand and actually turned out really cool!” Solsma said.
As usual there are a few new varieties of pumpkins and gourds to see.
In the general store there is the always popular Ruby Red Popcorn and products from about 17 local consignors including at least one that has been on had every year the shop has been open.
There are plenty of visitors that come by the pumpkin patch every year as well.
“It’s so cool to see kids that have grown up, and some have kids of their own now that they bring out too,” Solsma said. “It’s pretty special.”

author: VNExplorer
title: Mumbai-based cleric granted bail in third hate speech case in Gujarat, put in preventive detention
text:
Mumbai-based cleric granted bail in third hate speech case in Gujarat, put in preventive detention
Modasa, Feb 22 (PTI) Mumbai-based Islamic preacher Mufti Salman Azhari was on Thursday taken under preventive detention by the Gujarat police soon after he was granted bail in a hate speech case registered against him in the state’s Arvalli district.
Earlier in the day, the court of Additional Sessions Judge HN Vakil granted conditional bail to Azhari, who was booked for delivering an inflammatory speech in an open ground in Modasa on December 24 last year.
This was the third case of hate speech in Gujarat in which the cleric was arrested before being granted bail.
However, as soon as Azhari was released on bail, he was detained at Modasa by the Junagadh local crime branch under the Gujarat Prevention of Anti-Social Activities Act (PASA).
He will be handed over to Vadodara central jail, Junagadh crime branch inspector Jatin Patel said.
“We have detained him under PASA soon after a warrant was issued against him by the Junagadh collector,” Patel said.
The act allows the administration to take anti-social elements under preventive detention to maintain public safety.
Azhari was held from Mumbai on February 5 after he delivered an alleged hate speech in B division police station limits in Junagadh on January 31.
Later, Kutch East police registered a First Information Report (FIR) and arrested him on February 8 for delivering an allegedly provocative speech in Samakhiyari village in Bhachau taluka on January 31.
Azhari was earlier granted bail in cases registered against him in Junagadh and Kutch.
In Junagadh and Kutch East, Azhari was booked under Indian Penal Code sections 153B (promoting enmity between different religious groups) and 505 (2) (making statements conducive to public mischief).
Besides IPC sections 153 (B) and 505 (2), Azhari has also been charged under section 298 for uttering words with deliberate intent to wound the religious feelings of any person in the Modasa case.
According to the police, the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act has also been invoked as he made derogatory remarks against the SC community in his speech at Modasa.

author: Our Correspondent
title: Two killed, constable martyred in encounters
text: Three police encounters resulted in the death of two suspected criminals implicated in cases of murder and robbery, while a constable was martyred. Four suspected bandits were apprehended, including a woman and an injured man. The police seized weapons and motorcycles after the shootouts. The bodies were transported to hospitals for legal formalities. The funeral prayers of martyred Constable Abid were offered in the Police Lines. Eagle Squad personnel Abid and Bilal were patrolling the Dhandra Gurdwara Road in hikriwala when they signalled two suspicious men on a motorcycle to stop. However, one of the suspects opened fire on the police personnel, injuring Constable Abid in the neck and chest. The police retaliated, injuring one of the attacker. Constable Abid was rushed to the Allied Hospital by SHO Arslan Bari and another official in a private vehicle, but he succumbed to his injuries. His funeral prayers were offered after post-mortem and he was laid to rest in his native village. In another encounter in Razabad, Noman, a resident of Ghulam Muhammadabad, was struck by a bullet. ASI Khalid Amir rushed him to the Ghulam Muhammadabad General Hospital, but he succumbed to his injuries en route. Police sources said Noman was involved in a murder three days ago in the Ali Garden area, where he had shot and killed Rana Anas Gulfam over resistance while snatching a motorcycle from his brother Asad. Meanwhile, six armed robbers barged into the homes of Abdul Hafeez and Bilal in the Roshanwala area and fled after robbing them. The police apprehended four suspects, including the woman, while one man was injured. COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. For more information, please see our [Comments FAQ](/comments-policy)

author: @englishjagrannews
title: LIVE: IMD Red Alert As Dense Fog Blankets Delhi; Commuters Stranded With Trains Cancelled And Flights Delayed
text: LIVE: IMD Red Alert As Dense Fog Blankets Delhi; Commuters Stranded With Trains Cancelled And Flights Delayed - Author : [Vivek Raj](/authors/vivek-raj) - Updated: Fri, 29 Dec 2023 10:34 AM (IST) Breaking News LIVE Updates: The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Delhi on Friday, accompanied by an orange alert for December 30 and a yellow alert for the year-end and New Year's Eve. The capital, along with North India, is experiencing mist and dense fog, leading to significant travel disruptions and a surge in road accidents. The adverse weather conditions have resulted in the cancellation of several trains and delays in numerous flights. The region is advised to exercise caution due to reduced visibility and challenging travel conditions. India recorded 702 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, pushing the total active cases to 4,097, as per the latest health ministry data. Delhi has ordered genome sequencing for all positive cases to identify instances of the JN.1 subvariant. While the rising cases have raised concerns, experts are urging the public not to panic, and that the situation is being closely monitored. In a historic development, a tripartite agreement is anticipated to be finalised today between the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA), the Central Government, and the State Government. The primary goal of this agreement is to establish enduring peace in the northeastern state. The signing ceremony, scheduled to include Home Minister Amit Shah, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, and more than a dozen leaders from the pro-talk faction of ULFA, marks a significant step towards fostering stability in the region. - 10:34 AM, 29 Dec 2023 Shiv Sena Asserts Dominance In INDIA Alliance Seat Sharing Discussions In a statement on seat-sharing within the INDIA alliance, Shiv Sena Member of Parliament Sanjay Raut remarked, "This is Maharashtra, and Shiv Sena is the biggest party here. Congress is a national party." Addressing Congress's electoral performance in Maharashtra, Raut maintained, "Congress did not win a seat in Maharashtra, so they have to start from zero (seats), but Congress is an important ally for us in MVA (Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi)." - 09:48 AM, 29 Dec 2023 Rajinikanth Expresses Grief Over Captain Vijayakanth's Death Renowned actor Rajinikanth has shared heartfelt condolences on the demise of DMDK chief and actor Captain Vijayakanth. Rajinikanth said, "We will never get a person as good as Vijayakanth. In politics and cinema, there is no one like him. This loss is irreplaceable." - 09:47 AM, 29 Dec 2023 Delhi Weather: Dense Fog Delays Flights Amid Low Visibility Delhi witnessed dense fog on Friday morning, and due to adverse weather conditions and poor visibility, a few flights were delayed in the national capital at Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport. — ANI (@ANI) [#WATCH](https://twitter.com/hashtag/WATCH?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)| Delhi: Few flights delayed due to fog and low visibility in the national capital; Visuals from Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport As per airport sources, no diversions have been reported at IGI Airport till 8 am. [pic.twitter.com/snZVYgnEl0](https://t.co/snZVYgnEl0) [December 29, 2023](https://twitter.com/ANI/status/1740585292233691190?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

author: Rajshekhar Jha
title: Qaida-inspired terror plot foiled; 12 detained | India News - Times of India
text: NEW DELHI: The intelligence establishment has dismantled an al-Qaida-inspired module comprising extremist Wahhabis spread across several states, which was purportedly on the cusp of executing terror strikes. The intelligence agency orchestrated simultaneous operations in four states, culminating in the arrest of a dozen individuals. One of them, Dr Ishtiyaq Ahmed from Jharkhand, allegedly holds a pivotal position in the outfit, known as the al-Qaida in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). He was employed as a radiologist in a private clinic. However, a key operative of the module, codenamed Guddu, managed to escape from Mewat region during the raids, leaving the sleuths red-faced, according to sources in Rajasthan. A substantial cache of arms and ammunition has been confiscated during the raids and a training camp situated in Bhiwadi neutralised as well. The operation was conducted utilising sleuths from Delhi's special cell and anti-terror squads of various states.The training camp was operational in a densely forested area of Chopanki in Bhiwadi area of Rajasthan. About six-seven people were apprehended there. Apart from Dr Ahmed, the other suspects of the Ranchi module have been identified as Motiur, Rizwan, Mufti Rahmatullah and Faizan. Other arrested men are Hasan, Enamul, Altaf Ansari, Arshad, Umar Farooq and Shahbaz. In Jharkhand, the special task force (STF) sleuths conducted raids at 16 locations, including a madrassa in Ranchi, Hazaribag and Lohardaga, based on intelligence inputs. The neutralised module is linked to an AQIS module dismantled by agencies in 2016. Two of the men arrested in that operation, Abdul Rehman Katki and Abdul Sami, have resurfaced in this instance as well. Katki, who is currently in judicial custody, was alleged to have recruited boys from different districts like Ranchi, Jamshedpur, Lohardaga and Chatra to AQIS. A few were caught then while others managed to remain undetected and continue their operations. Some of the remaining operatives have now been nabbed. This module appeared to be inspired by AQ ideologue Abu Sufian, who is allegedly in Afghanistan. The seizure includes an AK-47 rifle, a .38 bore revolver, live cartridges of various calibres, a dummy Insas rifle, an air rifle and a hand grenade. Additionally, there were IED components, like an iron elbow pipe, a key remote-control mechanism, wires, a battery, a table watch, ground sheets, a target, a camping tent, and some food and drink items like biscuits, chips and a water bottle. A substantial amount of jihadi literature has also been confiscated. \"The module was aspiring to declare Khilafat and execute serious terrorist activities within the country. The members of the module have received indoctrination and weapons training at various locations. Six individuals were detained from Bhiwadi, Rajasthan, while undergoing weapon-handling training,\" said a statement from Delhi Police.

author: Peter DiGiovanni
title: Great Valley runs all over Lehigh Valley Academy, will face Pottstown in tournament final – Daily Local
text: EAST WHITELAND >> Wins have been hard to come by in the early stages of the season for the Great Valley boys basketball team. Thursday afternoon in the opening game of the Great Valley Holiday Tournament, the Patriots put it all together as they overran Lehigh Valley Academy, 55-17, to put the hosts into today’s championship game against Pottstown (who beat Upper Darby 48-44). The Patriots (3-6) shot 24-for-54 from the field and forced 27 Jaguar (1-4) turnovers as they consistently beat the Jaguars down the floor for a plethora of easy baskets in transition. “We ran our offense today and the guys got better,” Great Valley coach CJ Savage said. “We were the better team but we got to work on some things and we needed it because nine of our 13 guys are up from the junior varsity and are just getting used to playing varsity basketball. We did some nice things today.” Great Valley was led by senior center Jake Woodard, who tallied a game-high 20 points to go along with six rebounds. Woodard also drained a couple of three-balls and the Jaguars had no answer for the Patriots big man. The Patriots jetted out to an 18-5 lead in the first period. The Jaguars committed 17 first period turnovers and shot just 1-for-8 from the field in the opening quarter. Woodard and Marquis Alexander scored after Jaguars turnovers to give the Patriots the big first period lead. The Jaguars shot just 6-for-28 from the field for the game. Great Valley salted the game away to start the second period as they went on a 10-0 run to make it a 28-5 game. Will Mack opened the run by getting a backdoor layup. After a Jaguars turnover, Alexander scored inside. The Jaguars misfired on a three-ball and Woodard then took a nice feed from Tyler Markowski to make it a 24-5 game and the rout was on. Noah Metrick scored in transition and the Jaguars were effectively done. “We knew we were the better team but a win is a win,” Woodard said. “But, you always want to get better when you win a game and we ran our offense really well today. We have a lot of guys who are playing varsity basketball for the first time and they are starting to come together and understand when to make a pass and when not to. They are adjusting to the pace of the game at the varsity level.” Great Valley held a 38-9 lead at halftime and the Patriots quickly put the game into the 30 point mercy rule in the third period when Woodard scored in the lane to make the score 40-9. Alexander then scored on a follow, and it was Alexander’s sixth rebound of the game. Savage cleared his bench after Alexander’s basket and the Patriots reserves played the rest of the game. “We worked on our offense out there today,” Alexander said. “We were running our cuts very well and even though we took a big lead early we locked in. Anytime you go between the lines you have to lock in and do your job and we did that today even though we got up big early.” Great Valley 55, Lehigh Valley Academy 17 LEHIGH VALLEY ACADEMY (17) Wilkins 3 3-7 9, Orozco 0 1-2 1, McNeil 2 0-0 5, Haylock 1 0-0 2, Seibert 0 0-0 0, Soriano 0 0-0 0, McArtheu 0 0-0 0. Totals 6 4-9 17. GREAT VALLEY (55) Mack 1 0-0 2, Markowski 0 0-0 0, McDaniel 0 1-4 1, Stahl 2 0-0 4, Person 1 0-0 2, Metrick 3 2-2 8, Weikert 2 0-0 4, J.Woodard 9 0-0 20, Levine 2 0-0 4, Benson 0 1-2 1, Alexander 2 0-0 4, C.Woodard 2 0-0 5. Lehigh Valley Academy 5 4 6 2-17 Great Valley 18 20 10 7-55 3-point goals: McNeil, J.Woodard 2, C.Woodard. On Thu, Dec 28, 2023 at 2:11 PM Peter DiGiovanni wrote:
